oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stark, E. M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Federal Troop Barracks, Gallatin, Tennessee
Gallatin Public Square with Federal Troops
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The image depicts troop formations around a courthouse with cupola. There are five artillery pieces in front of the courthouse, positioned around a large, open square with one pointed down a street. Other vignettes in the scene include a man driving a laden carriage out of the square, a group of soldiers standing around buckets on a fire next to a table, and a couple of soldiers on horseback in the foreground.

E. M. Stark was a photographer in Gallatin, Tennessee. While he may or may not have been involved in the war effort, his drawing provides a detailed, first-hand view of the activity of federal soldiers in this important northern Middle Tennessee city.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Pictorial works
Visualizing the War
